result.execSummary:
The defendant Adriana N Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Arresting Agency: FAPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

supervisions.notes:
Court sentences Ms. Torres to 3 years 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year 6 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith. 

6/5/17 - The Court modifies the Sentence to be that the Court sentences Ms. Torres to 1 year and 3 months with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 months, forthwith. 
The Court gives 440 days credit for time already served. 
The Court finds that Ms. Torres is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program.

7/21/17: Per 7/21/17 Order Ms. Torres' sentence for this case is 1 year initial confinement and 3 months of extended supervision (per the court's modification on 6/5/17). Ms. Torres has 185 (not 440) days of sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
6/5/17 - The Court modifies the previously ordered condition to "any dating relationship shall be approved by the Agent."

Arresting Agency: Fort Atkinson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

7/21/17: Court orders that the previously ordered condition that Ms. Torres "Not have any intimate relationships" is modified to "any dating relationship shall be approved by the Agent".

The Court finds that Ms. Torres is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: re: postconviction motion

On Defendant's 5/15/17 Postconviction Motion 
[MK] case called at 1:40pm. 
Defendant Adriana N Torres in court, in custody, with Attorney Tristan Breedlove.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
After a discussion between the Court and counsel, on stipulation of the parties the Court changes the Extended Supervision condition from "Defendant not to have any intimate relationships" to now be:  any dating relationship shall be approved by the Agent  
After hearing the arguments of counsel, the Court finds that the Court's Sentence has been thwarted. 
ADA Shock indicates that the State concedes that the new factor-analysis has been met.  
recess 2:17pm, reconvene 2:26pm. 

The Court modifies the Sentence to be that the Court sentences Ms. Torres to 1 year and 3 months with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 months, forthwith. 
The Court gives 440 days credit for time already served. 
The Court finds that Ms. Torres is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision those conditions that were previously ordered, however with the condition-modification made by stipulation at this hearing [which are: 
--to obtain and maintain employment 
--to pay outstanding costs and fees]
--any dating relationship shall be approved by the Agent

Explanation of Determinate Sentence form is provided to the Defendant.   
recess 2:36pm
CC: Certified Copy to DA on 5/17/17 - hb

Case called at 2:32 pm [sf]
Defendant Adriana N Torres in court, in custody with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes. ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Humes and ADA Shock advise that they have received the Revocation Packet and have no factual corrections.
ADA Shock presents sentencing recommendations.
Attorney Humes presents sentencing argument.
Defendant makes a statement.

Court sentences Ms. Torres to 3 years 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year 6 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 185 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--To obtain and maintain employment 
--To pay outstanding costs and fees
--Defendant not to have any intimate relationships


Court finds that the parties stipulate that the amount of credit listed on the Revocation Order and Warrant is accurate.
Court orders Attorney Humes to confir with the Defendant and sign and date the Right to Seek Postconviction Relief. 

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 3:11 pm
Attorney Samantha Humes

Case called at 1:34pm [mo]
Defendant Adriana N Torres in court, in custody with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: all remaining Counts.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court adopts the joint recommendation of the parties
On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars or taverns
--to submit DNA sample upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge

Days credit for time already served:  3  days
recess: 2:02pm
Made by Defense on this Date
Scheduling Order
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 11:02am 
[On Scram Violation]
Defendant Adriana N Torres in court, in custody with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

Timothy Taylor of Wisconsin Community Service--sworn and testifies
--direct examination by ADA Teuber
--cross examination by Atty. Luchsinger

Argument given by Atty. Luchsinger
The Court finds that the SCRAM monitoring device is for purposes of making bail determination accurately and reliable
The Court summarizes State v. HInz
The Court finds that there has been a violation of Ms. Torres' bail.

The Court amends Ms. Toress' bond to $1000 CASH, with same non-monetary conditions as previously imposed.
Atty. Luchsinger requests a Speedy Trial 
The Court distributes its scheduling order.
Upon inquiry from ADA Teuber, the Court orally amends its scheduling order to allow any motions to be filed 20 days prior to the FSSC. 
Atty. Luchsinger inquires of the Court whether the Court's schedule could accommodate a possible plea and sentencing this afternoon.
--The Court indicates that it could arrange that to be scheduled if needed. 
recess: 11:40am

NEXT: 1)Status Conference on 10/6/15 at 9:00am  2)FSSC on 10/26/15 at 1:00pm 3)Jury Trial on 10/29/15 at 8:30am
State's
Evidentiary hearing at 09-18-2015 11:00 am
Scheduling Notice
Defendant in custody/ Duplicate Original Warrant returned by JCSD

Case called at 10:07am [mo]
[Hearing on Scram Violation]
Defendant Adriana N Torres in court, in custody with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Luchsinger indicates that the State is not prepared to proceed today
Atty. Luchsinger requests that Ms. Torres be re-released on the Scram monitor; gives arguments
ADA Shock notes that the State received notice of this hearing approximately an hour before the hearing and therefore is unprepared to proceed today
recess:10:16am--reconvene:10:20am [For Scheduling]
The Court reviews the Court Record
The Court declines to release Mr. Torres, she is to be held until the Evidentiary Hearing. 
recess: 10:23am
NEXT: Evidentiary Hearing on Scram Violation on 9/18/15 at 11:00am
For alleged violations of SCRAM monitoring (see attached.)  Upon arrest, the defendant is to be brought before Judge Wambach for hearing only, not the intake court
Notice of SCRAM violation with letter from WCS regarding the violation

Tim Taylor of WCS (SCRAM installer) stopped in looking for clarification on the court's order for waiver of fees).   Mr. Taylor indicated that the client was willing/able to pay $20 a month, but he had received information that the fee had been waived by the court.

A review of the record with the court reporter showed that the clerk's minutes were in error from the 8/10 hearing - that the court ordered reduction of fees, not waiver.  Minutes were corrected accordingly.  Corrected information provided to WCS-Sara Carpenter.    CJR
Status conference at 10-06-2015 09:00 am
Pre-trial conference at 08-26-2015 11:00 am

Clerks note: A call was placed to WCS ref waiver of fees for SCRAM. Mr Taylor advised he was in contact with his superviser as to how they should proceed, WCS will not waive fees, someone will have to cover the costs.
Scheduling notice

Case called at 9:04 am [Clerk SH]
[Honorable Judge Randy R. Koschnick presiding for BrIII]
Defendant Adriana N Torres in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Ms.Torres  waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Atty Luchsinger orally motions to reduce fee for SCRAM - discussions held; Miss Torres informs the Court that WCS told her to request the Court for order to waive fees, will not do on own
Court presents basis and indicates that fees for SCRAM shall be at a reduced rate
Recess: 9:09 am

Case called at 2:02 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Adriana N Torres appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Miss Torres is eligible for SPD services 
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on .  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only - to be accomplished today.*
-Absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or package houses
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Adrian Torres or Richard Battersby
-No acts or threats of violence
Recess: 2:09 pm

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 6/24/15 at 9:40 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 7/21/15 9:00 am - Send notices
